s.text: Squeezed amid the booths hawking used car fenders, lacy underwear, and $15 bootleg copies of Microsoft Windows '98 are makeshift restaurants, constructed for the day out of tarps and folding chairs.
Guest rooms are residential and warm, with framed collages of vintage Chicago postcards on the walls."
I'm not sure where the backlash would hit in Chicago, but I'll keep my eyes open for fashion models wearing Hawaiian shirts and white patent-leather shoes.
